org.jtrim.image.transform

Class AffineImagePointTransformer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.image.transform.AffineImagePointTransformer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImagePointTransformer

    public final class AffineImagePointTransformer
extends java.lang.Object
implements ImagePointTransformer
    Defines a coordinate transformation of 2D points (two dimensional vectors) where the coordinate transformation can be described by an affine transformation. That is, where the transformation can be represented by a linear transformation and an offset.

    Thread safety

    Instances of this class are safe to be called from multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are synchronization transparent.

    • Field Detail

      • IDENTITY

        public static final ImagePointTransformer IDENTITY
        Defines an identity transformation. That is, a coordinate transformation which transforms input coordinates to the same coordinates.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AffineImagePointTransformer

        public AffineImagePointTransformer(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform srcToDest)
        Creates a new AffineImagePointTransformer which is based on the the given affine transformation. The source coordinate system is from which the specified AffineTransform.transform method transforms the 2D points.
        Parameters:
        srcToDest - the AffineTransform defining the transformation from the source coordinates to destination coordinates. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified transformation is null

    • Method Detail

      • transformSrcToDest

        public void transformSrcToDest(java.awt.geom.Point2D src,
                      java.awt.geom.Point2D dest)
        Transforms the given 2D point from the source coordinate system to the destination coordinate system.

        The source and destination point objects are allowed to be the same object.

        Specified by:
        transformSrcToDest in interface ImagePointTransformer
        Parameters:
        src - the point to be transformed to the destination coordinate system. This argument cannot be null and this method is not allowed to modify this argument.
        dest - the point object where the result of the transformation is to be stored. This method modifies this argument. This argument cannot be null.

      • transformDestToSrc

        public void transformDestToSrc(java.awt.geom.Point2D dest,
                      java.awt.geom.Point2D src)
                        throws java.awt.geom.NoninvertibleTransformException
        Transforms the given 2D point from the destination coordinate system to the source coordinate system.

        The source and destination point objects are allowed to be the same object.

        This method is the inverse transformation of transformSrcToDest. Note however, that due to rounding errors, applying this method to a point created by transformSrcToDest may not yield exactly the same source point.

        Implementation note: The transformation is not invertible if it transforms points to a line or to a single point.

        Specified by:
        transformDestToSrc in interface ImagePointTransformer
        Parameters:
        dest - the point to be transformed to the source coordinate system. This argument cannot be null and this method is not allowed to modify this argument.
        src - the point object where the result of the transformation is to be stored. This method modifies this argument. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.awt.geom.NoninvertibleTransformException - thrown if the transformation cannot be done because the source to destination transformation cannot be inverted
